definition: To express disagreement or raise objections during a discussion or debate, often used when presenting counterarguments or pointing out flaws in someone else's argument.

examples.english: I would like to object that...
You can object to it, but...
I have to raise an important objection.

examples.german: Es gibt keinen Grund, dagegen einzuwenden.
examples.english: There is no reason to object to it.
